channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-12266] When client exists abnormally, it doesn't release ACID locks
item.description:
if you start Hive CLI (locking enabled) and run some command that acquires locks and ^C the shell before command completes the locks for the command remain until they timeout.

I believe Beeline has the same issue.

Need to add proper hooks to release locks when command dies. (As much as possible)
item.summary: When client exists abnormally, it doesn't release ACID locks

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Verified this problem exist for both CLI and Beeline. The fix is in Driver.java so should fix for both.
Precommit test got cancelled by someone.. Resubmit

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12769808/HIVE-12266.1.patch

ATTACHMENT ID: 12769808 - PreCommit-HIVE-TRUNK-Build

Wei Zheng I'm not sure it's a good idea to initialize HiveTxnManager in the ShutdownHook from Driver().
It may not even be set there yet. It is first set in Driver.compile() with "SessionState.get().initTxnMgr(conf);"
So I think the manager should be passed to the hook there (or even from SessionState.initTxnMgr())

Makes sense. But based on my experiments, the transaction manager was there in Driver constructor. Maybe we get it from the previous query in the same session? Is transaction manager corresponding to a session or to a query?
Session, currently, though that may change in the future.
Made changes based on Eugene Koifman's comment

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12769906/HIVE-12266.3.patch

Test failures irrelevant. Eugene Koifman Can you take another look?

committed to master: https://github.com/apache/hive/commit/595fa9988fcb3e67b60845b44e1df4cc49ce38b2
patch doesn't apply on branch-1
Adding 2.0.0 as fix version as it was committed to master as well.

Wei Zheng, To my understand, this JIRA could only address the issue for CLI, but not for beeline. Since the shutdown hook could only be invoked when JVM running the Driver is shutdown, in beeline case, the beeline is running in a different JVM from HS2. Is that correct?
